translated: “Kassapa is content with any kind of robe, and he praises being content with any kind of robe.

analyzed: santuṭṭhāya bhikkhave kassapo itarītarena piṇḍapātena itarītara piṇḍapāta santuṭṭhiyā  ca vaṇṇa vādī na ca piṇḍapāta hetu anesanam appatirūpam āpajjati aladdhā ca piṇḍapāta  na paritassati laddhā ca piṇḍapātam a gadhitaḥ a mucchitaḥ an ajjhāpannaḥ ādīnava dassāvī

original: nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.
analyzed: nissaraṇa paññaḥ paribhuñjati

analyzed: santuṭṭhāya bhikkhave kassapo itarītarena senāsanena itarītara senāsana santuṭṭhiyā  ca vaṇṇa vādī na ca senāsana hetu anesanam appatirūpam āpajjati aladdhā ca senāsana
translated: Kassapa is content with any kind of resting place at all. He speaks in praise of being content with any kind of resting place at all. He does not engage in wrong methods of livelihood in order to get a resting place. He does not, not getting a resting place,

analyzed: na paritassati laddhā ca senāsanam a gadhitaḥ a mucchitaḥ an ajjhāpannaḥ ādīnava dassāvī  nissaraṇa paññaḥ paribhuñjati  santuṭṭhāya bhikkhave kassapaḥ itarītarena gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārena  itarītara gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra santuṭṭhiyā ca vaṇṇa vādī na ca gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra hetu  an esanam appatirūpam āpajjati a laddhā ca gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāram na paritassati

original: laddhā ca gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ agadhito amucchito anajjhāpanno ādīnavadassāvī🔽nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.
analyzed: laddhā ca gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāram a gadhitaḥ a mucchitaḥ an ajjhāpannaḥ ādīnava dassāvī 🔽nissaraṇa paññaḥ paribhuñjati

When he doesn’t get better medicinal requisites, he doesn’t get upset. When he gets them, he uses them without being tied to them, infatuated with them, and indulgent in them. He sees the danger in them and is aware of the escape.

original: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ: ‘santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena cīvarena, itarītaracīvarasantuṭṭhiyā ca vaṇṇavādino; na ca cīvarahetu anesanaṁ appatirūpaṁ āpajjissāma;
analyzed: tasmāt iha bhikkhave evam sikkhitabba santuṭṭhāḥ bhavissāma itarītarena cīvarena itarītara cīvara santuṭṭhiyā ca vaṇṇa vādinaḥ na ca cīvara hetu anesanam appatirūpam āpajjissāma
translated: “Therefore, bhikkhus, you should train yourselves thus: ‘We will be content with any kind of robe, and we will speak in praise of being content with any kind of robe, and we will not engage in improper search for robe-cloth and in evil actions for the sake of robe-cloth.

original: aladdhā ca cīvaraṁ na ca paritassissāma; laddhā ca cīvaraṁ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāma’.
analyzed: a laddhā ca cīvaram na ca paritassissāma laddhā ca cīvaram a gadhitā a mucchitā an ajjhāpannāḥ ādīnava dassāvinaḥ nissaraṇa paññā paribhuñjissāma
translated: If we do not get robe-cloth, we will not be agitated; and if we get it, we will use it without being tied to it, infatuated with it, and blindly absorbed in it, seeing the danger in it and understanding the escape from it.’

original: (Evaṁ sabbaṁ kātabbaṁ.)🔽‘Santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena piṇḍapātena …pe…
analyzed: evam sabbam kātabba  santuṭṭhāḥ bhavissāmaḥ itarītarena piṇḍapātena pe
translated: (The same method is to be used in regard to almsfood, a resting place, and medicinal requisites.)

original: santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena senāsanena …pe…🔽santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena, itarītaragilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārasantuṭṭhiyā
analyzed: santuṭṭhāḥ bhavissāmaḥ itarītarena senāsanena pe  santuṭṭhāḥ bhavissāma itarītarena gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārena itarītara gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra santuṭṭhiyā
translated: ‘We will be content with any kind of almsfood, and we will speak in praise of being content with any kind of almsfood, and we will not engage in improper search for almsfood and in evil actions for the sake of almsfood.🔽We will be content with any kind of resting place, and we will speak in praise of being content with any kind of resting place, and we will not engage in improper search for a resting place and in evil actions for the sake of a resting place.

original: ca vaṇṇavādino; na ca gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu anesanaṁ appatirūpaṁ āpajjissāma
analyzed: ca vaṇṇa vādinaḥ na ca gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra hetu anesanam appatirūpam āpajjissāma
translated: We will be content with any kind of medicinal requisites, and we will speak in praise of being content with any kind of medicinal requisites, and we will not engage in improper search for medicinal requisites and in evil actions for the sake of medicinal requisites.

original: aladdhā ca gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ na paritassissāma; laddhā ca gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ
analyzed: a laddhā ca gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāram na paritassissāma laddhā ca gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra
translated: And if we don’t get the requisite medicine, we won’t be distressed.

original: agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāmā’ti.
analyzed: a gadhitāḥ a mucchitāḥ an ajjhāpannāḥ ādīnava dassāvino nissaraṇa paññā paribhuñjissāma ati
translated: We will use the requisite medicine we have obtained without being tied to it, infatuated with it, and blindly absorbed in it, seeing the danger in it and understanding the escape from it.’

original: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam hi vaḥ bhikkhave sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train yourselves.🔽I instruct you, monks, with Kassapa or with anyone else like Kassapa.”

original: Kassapena vā hi vo, bhikkhave, ovadissāmi yo vā panassa kassapasadiso, ovaditehi ca pana vo tathattāya paṭipajjitabban”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 16.2

translated: ‘The Blessed One’s son, born of his breast, born of his mouth, born of the Dhamma, created by the Dhamma, an heir in the Dhamma, not an heir in material things,’ then he would be speaking rightly.

original: ‘bhagavato putto oraso mukhato jāto dhammajo dhammanimmito dhammadāyādo, paṭiggahitāni sāṇāni paṁsukūlāni nibbasanānī’ti.🔽Ahaṁ kho, āvuso, yāvade ākaṅkhāmi vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi.

translated: ‘The Blessed One’s son, born of his breast, born of his mouth, born of the Dhamma, created by the Dhamma, an heir in the Dhamma, not an heir in material things.’🔽“To the extent that I want, friend, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, I enter and dwell in the first jhāna, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by thought and examination.

original: Ahaṁ kho, āvuso, yāvade ākaṅkhāmi …pe…🔽(navannaṁ anupubbavihārasamāpattīnaṁ pañcannañca abhiññānaṁ evaṁ vitthāro veditabbo.)
analyzed: aham khalu āvuso yāvade ākaṅkhāmi pe  navannam anupubba vihāra samāpattīnam pañcannam ca abhiññānam evam vitthāraḥ veditabbo
translated: To the extent that I want, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, I enter and dwell in the second jhāna, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of concentration, without thought and examination.🔽To the extent that I want, with the fading away as well of rapture, I dwell equanimous and, mindful and clearly comprehending, I experience pleasure with the body; I enter and dwell in the third jhāna of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells happily.’🔽To the extent that I want, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, I enter and dwell in the fourth jhāna, neither painful nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.🔽To the extent that I want, by completely surmounting the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, I enter and dwell in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: Ahaṁ kho, āvuso, āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi;
analyzed: aham kho āvuso āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi
translated: “To the extent that I want, friend, by depending upon and relying upon this Dhamma, I enter and dwell in the deliverance of mind and deliverance by wisdom that are taintless with the destruction of the taints.

original: sattaratanaṁ vā, āvuso, nāgaṁ aḍḍhaṭṭhamaratanaṁ vā tālapattikāya chādetabbaṁ maññeyya, yo me cha abhiññā chādetabbaṁ maññeyyā”ti.

analyzed: na hete āvuso attha sahitam na ādibrahmacariyakam na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya savattati
translated: “That’s not connected with the goal, friend, not connected with the Dhamma, not basic to the holy life. It doesn’t lead to disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, calming, direct knowledge, self-awakening, or unbinding.

original: Tasmā taṁ abyākataṁ bhagavatā”ti.
analyzed: tasmai tam a vyākatam bhagavatā ati
translated: That’s why it hasn’t been declared by the Blessed One.”

original: “Atha kiñcarahāvuso, byākataṁ bhagavatā”ti?

translated: “‘This is stress’ has been declared by the Blessed One;🔽‘This is the origination of stress’ has been declared by the Blessed One;

original: ayaṁ ‘dukkhanirodho’ti byākataṁ bhagavatā;

translated: ‘This is the cessation of stress’ has been declared by the Blessed One;

translated: ‘This is the path of practice leading to the cessation of stress’ has been declared by the Blessed One.”

original: “Kasmā cetaṁ, āvuso, byākataṁ bhagavatā”ti?
analyzed: kasmai ca itas āvusaḥ byākatam bhagavatā ati
translated: “And why has that been declared by the Blessed One?”

original: “Etañhi, āvuso, atthasaṁhitaṁ etaṁ ādibrahmacariyakaṁ etaṁ nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: etat hi āvuso attha sahitam etam ādibrahmacariyakam etam nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: “Because that is connected with the goal, friend, connected with the Dhamma, basic to the holy life. It leads to disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, calming, direct knowledge, self-awakening, & unbinding.

original: Tasmā taṁ byākataṁ bhagavatā”ti.
analyzed: tasmai tam byākatam bhagavatā ati
translated: That’s why it has been declared by the Blessed One.”

original: Dvādasamaṁ.

original: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā mahākassapo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:

translated: Then the venerable Maha Kassapa approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and said to him:

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena pubbe appatarāni ceva sikkhāpadāni ahesuṁ bahutarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahiṁsu?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena pubbe appatarāni ca iva sikkhāpadāni ahesum bahutarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahisu
translated: “Venerable sir, what is the reason, what is the cause why in the past there were fewer training rules and more bhikkhus were established in final knowledge?

original: Ko pana, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yenetarahi bahutarāni ceva sikkhāpadāni appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena itarahi bahutarāni ca iva sikkhāpadāni appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahanti iti
translated: What is the reason, what is the cause why now there are more training rules and fewer bhikkhus are established in final knowledge?”

original: “Evañcetaṁ, kassapa, hoti sattesu hāyamānesu saddhamme antaradhāyamāne, bahutarāni ceva sikkhāpadāni honti appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahanti.
analyzed: evañca ita kassapa hoti sattesu hāyamānesu saddhamme antaradhāyamāne bahutarāni ca iva sikkhāpadāni honti appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahanti
translated: “Kassapa, when beings are in decline, when the true Dhamma is disappearing, there are more training rules and fewer bhikkhus are established in final knowledge.

original: Na tāva, kassapa, saddhammassa antaradhānaṁ hoti yāva na saddhammappatirūpakaṁ loke uppajjati.
analyzed: na tāva kassapa saddhammassa antaradhānam hoti yāva na saddhamma patirūpakam loke uppajjati
translated: But as long as a counterfeit of the true Dhamma does not appear in the world, the true Dhamma does not disappear.

original: Yato ca kho, kassapa, saddhammappatirūpakaṁ loke uppajjati, atha saddhammassa antaradhānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yatas ca kho kassapa saddhamma patirūpakam loke uppajjati atha saddhammassa antaradhānam hoti
translated: But when a counterfeit of the true Dhamma appears in the world, then the true Dhamma disappears.

original: Seyyathāpi, kassapa, na tāva jātarūpassa antaradhānaṁ hoti yāva na jātarūpappatirūpakaṁ loke uppajjati.
analyzed: seyyathā api kassapa na tāva jātarūpassa antaradhānam hoti yāva na jātarūpa patirūpakam loke uppajjati
translated: Just as gold does not disappear as long as counterfeit gold does not appear in the world.

original: Yato ca kho, kassapa, jātarūpappatirūpakaṁ loke uppajjati, atha kho jātarūpassa antaradhānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yatas ca kho kassapa jātarūpa patirūpakam loke uppajjati atha kho jātarūpassa antaradhānam hoti

original: Evameva kho, kassapa, na tāva saddhammassa antaradhānaṁ hoti yāva na saddhammappatirūpakaṁ loke uppajjati.
analyzed: evam eva kho kassapa na tāva saddhammassa antaradhānam hoti yāva na saddhamma patirūpakam loke uppajjati
translated: So too, Kassapa, the true Dhamma does not disappear as long as a counterfeit of the true Dhamma does not appear in the world.

original: Yato ca kho, kassapa, saddhammappatirūpakaṁ loke uppajjati, atha saddhammassa antaradhānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yatas ca kho kassapa saddhamma patirūpakam loke uppajjati atha saddhammassa antaradhānam hoti
translated: But when a counterfeit of the true Dhamma appears in the world, then the true Dhamma disappears.

original: Na kho, kassapa, pathavīdhātu saddhammaṁ antaradhāpeti, na āpodhātu saddhammaṁ antaradhāpeti, na tejodhātu saddhammaṁ antaradhāpeti, na vāyodhātu saddhammaṁ antaradhāpeti;
analyzed: na kho kassapa pathavī dhātu saddhammam antaradhāpeti na āpaḥ dhātu saddhammam antaradhāpeti na tejaḥ dhātu saddhammam antaradhāpeti na vāyo dhātu saddhammam antaradhāpeti
translated: It’s not that the earth element causes the disappearance of the true Teaching. It’s not that the water element, the heat element, or the wind element causes the disappearance of the true Teaching.

original: atha kho idheva te uppajjanti moghapurisā ye imaṁ saddhammaṁ antaradhāpenti.
analyzed: atha kho idha iva te uppajjanti mogha purisāḥ ye imam saddhammam antaradhāpenti
translated: It’s the foolish people who appear here who cause the disappearance of the true Teaching.

original: Seyyathāpi, kassapa, nāvā ādikeneva opilavati;
analyzed: seyyathā api kassapa nāvā ādikena iva opilavati
translated: It’s like a boat that sinks right from the start.

original: na kho, kassapa, evaṁ saddhammassa antaradhānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: na kho kassapa evam saddhammassa antaradhānam hoti
translated: The disappearance of the true Teaching doesn’t happen like that.

original: Pañca khome, kassapa, okkamaniyā dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: pañca khome kassapa okkamaniyā dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya savattanti
